intro: Hibbertia incana, commonly known as the woolly false sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and showy yellow flowers with prominent central disks. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Hibbertia incana is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Its foliage is covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
